intro: Carpodiptera cubensis subsp. cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban sandpiper orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the island of Cuba. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or swampy areas. Its blooming period occurs during the wet season, and it is adapted to the humid tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
